alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:24AM EDT until August 05 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR OHIO COUNTY... At 424 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall has fallen across the county, with the heaviest down along the Ohio and Muhlenberg border. Up to another inch of rainfall is possible over the next hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hartford, Beaver Dam, Fordsville, Centertown, Mchenry, Rockport, Rochester, Dukehurst, Jingo and Sandefur Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
